sub_title: International Business Student • Social Media Marketing Manager • International Student Ambassador
summary:
Second-year International Business student, future marketing executive. My passion for languages and leadership brought me to NHL Stenden, University of Applied Sciences in the Netherlands, where I am working on my BBA in International Business. During the past academic year I have been an active member of various student associations and councils, which allowed me to further hone my communication, organisation and management skills.

The most valuable lesson I have learned from NHL so far has been the importance of properly communicating and understanding cultural differences, when wanting to successfully work together in an international environment. After completing a semester-long project on “International Business Strategy”, which entailed a major focus on “Marketing” and “Research”, I am looking forward to another project in the areas of “Finance” and “Supply Chain Management” in the second half of this academic year. Both major topics will include a close collaboration with companies, to ensure that the acquired knowledge is immediately put into action and transformed into real life experience. Additionally, “Business Transformers” classes continue to teach me important lessons in psychological and societal topics, concerning both the people around me and myself. 

After having reached the A2 level in Dutch ahead of my classes, I am dedicating myself and my freetime to reaching another proficiency level in Russian. Additionally, I continue to build skills in HTML5 and CSS, while taking a closer look at modern business skills, to ensure that I have the proper knowledge and preparation for my upcoming internship in the next academic year.

projects.title: International Business Strategy
projects.description:
Within the second academic year of the "International Business" programme students were required to collaborate with a company, to analyse their current international strategy and to create three potential strategic international choices based on the research conducted. The focus of this project laid on marketing and sales, as well as international trade. 

The project group collaborated with Nieland B.V, a hydraulic equipment and cold forming ship building press supplier located in Leeuwarden, the Netherlands.

projects.title: International Trade Mission
projects.description:
Withint the second academic year of the "International Business" programme students were required to participate in an international project week, to broaden their knowledge horizons and to gain additional practical international experience. Out of the potential projects offered I have chosen the “International Trade Mission” held in Rome, hosted by the Swiss Management School. 

The focus of this project laid on exporting an existing product to the Italian market, which involved delivering sales pitches to potential customers and stepping into the role of sales and export consultants for the chosen project company, Dutch Padel B.V.

projects.title: Digital Marketing Strategy - Youth Work Ireland Midlands
projects.description: Within the Short Advanced Programme at the TUS in Ireland, the project group worked on a digital marketing strategy, with a specific focus on celebrating volunteers, for the non-profit organisation "Youth Work Ireland Midlands". The main focus of the project laid on utilising the most used social media applications in Ireland to attract new customers and funders, while also creating ways to celebrate volunteers on a regional as well as national level.

projects.title: Analysing the Degree of Internationalisation of SMI Groep's Maritime Division
projects.description:
Within the first academic year of the "International Business" programme students were required to analyse a company's degree of internationalisation, their general company structure and current trends within the industry they operate in. Based on this my project group and I developed recommendations for daily operations and their approach to certain international markets.

The company we collaborated with was SMI Groep, a metal processing group located in the province of Friesland in the Netherlands. Within SMI Groep we focused on their maritime division, comprising of five companies specialising in different aspects of ship and yacht building. 

The main learning outcomes of this project were focused on methods used within applied research, as well as industry analyses and benchmarking.

profile_positions.description:
• Spearheading end-to-end social media marketing efforts for a sustainable Dutch fashion brand, operating independently to drive brand visibility and engagement.
• Crafting innovative social media strategies designed to elevate brand presence, foster customer connections, and expand the international client base.
• Tailoring content and campaigns to diverse target audiences, ensuring a personalised experience across Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, and TikTok.
• Leveraging my creative prowess to conceptualize, shoot, and design captivating visual content, enhancing brand aesthetics and storytelling.
• Analysing and interpreting data-driven insights to continually optimise strategies, increasing audience engagement and delivering actionable recommendations to the client.
• Serving as a trusted consultant, collaborating closely with the client to align marketing efforts with brand objectives and advising on industry best practices.
• Expanding the brand's global reach through strategic initiatives, attracting and nurturing an international clientele.

volunteer_experiences.description:
• Represented the student body of 4.000-5.000 students and the school in workshops, events and for press related matters.
• Led the organisation of student events and festivities, which included general leisure events such as annual summer and winter parties, but also specific educational events such as workshops on public speaking and personal development.
• Organised a blood donation event in collaboration with the German Red Cross, which resulted in both students and non-students donating almost 100 litres of blood.
• Participated in the anti-crime task force of Neumünster, a council comprised of representatives of the city, the police, legal advisors and parties in the affected areas of high crime rates, as well as individuals passionate about change for the better.
• Initiated a sustainability project, with the aim to introduce more greenery and bee friendliness to the school grounds. This resulted in more wild flowers being planted and insect hotels being built and distributed on several of the school properties.

• Assisted the school president and vice president during my first year. 
• Represented a student body of 4.000-5.000 students for any matters.
• Helped in the planning of fairs and summer events.
• Advised the board of the school.

• Represented classes of up to 30 people with up to 12 different nationalities in all student matters.
• Attended regular meetings and sessions on communicating issues and finding solutions for the student body.
• Facilitated between students, teachers and middle management.

• Assisting in the planning, structuring and implementation of the Study Start Week for International Business, an eventful introduction week designed to ease new students into their studies.
• Providing guidance for new students for any matters, both study related and personal.
